greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n lists numbers d-1 that do not divide n, where d divides n.
comment: It appears that only rows 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 have the property that all their members are primes. See the example. See also the comment at A018253.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 3..1000, flattened
mathematica: Flatten[Table[d = Divisors[n]; Select[Rest[d-1], Mod[n, #] > 0 &], {n, 3 , 100}]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 23 2011 *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Sep 19 2011
